Summary In 2007, Wei started his career as researcher at Intel China Research Center working on a wide range of projects from memory architecture, virtualization to SoC FPGA simulation/emulation with host device driver. In 2011, Wei moved to Intel Santa Clara for heterogeneous imaging library development, and later worked on improving Xeon production efficiency through HVM software development. In 2014, Wei moved to Intel SSG DPD for Intel proprietary software profiler (VTune/SEP/EMON) backend development.  
Wei has gained solid technical knowledge in system software, OS, device driver, computer architecture exploration/prototyping, performance tuning, HVM development. Summary I am a highly motivated software professional with more than six year of experience in developing cutting-edge technologies and three years of Ph.D. research experience in programming language theory and formal software verification. 
 
My current work focuses on developing the Goanna static code analyser, which helps C/C++ developers in an industrial setting to write better/safer code with less bugs. 
 
Previously, I have played key roles in projects developing private-preserving big-data infrastructure, innovative testing/debugging tools, Linux device drivers for new SoCs, Virtual Platforms for system-level simulation/co-emulation and compilation technology for advanced ISA features.  
 
My key technical skills and knowledge include:  
 
► Software development skills in C/C++, OCaml, Scala, Java, Bash and Python  
► Expertise in programming language theory, functional programming and formal verification 
► Substantial understanding of computer architecture and embedded system design  
► Knowledge in parallel/distributed computing and Big Data infrastructures 
► Multiple domain knowledge drawing from diverse experience 
 
My roles have also required technical skills, effective team-working and communication skills, attention to detail, love of learning, proactive attitude, dedication and the ability to deliver outstanding solutions in high pressure situations.
